page.title: 18AERO CLUB:NORTH/ELTON
page.content:
The Peterborough Aero Club is a flying club with approximately 97 members and another 10 to 20 in training. Trained by a variety of people - 2 flying instructors, almost full-time, 2 RAF pilots from Wittering, 4 duty pilots, plus a man on the radio, and volunteer firemen (drawn from Busy Bee and Apply Aviation on the airfield).
They provide flying training at Â£52 per hour for students. Hire of planes - to licenced pilots for aerial photography. Hangerage - for a maximum of 30 planes. 10 private planes at present using space, the rest belong to other users of the airfield.
